metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24763 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
PJSIP is a free and open source multimedia communication library written inthe C language. Versions 2.12 and prior contain a denial-of-servicevulnerability that affects PJSIP users that consume PJSIP's XML parsing intheir apps. Users are advised to update. There are no known workarounds.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jami - 20230206.0~ds2-1.3
jami-daemon - 20230206.0~ds2-1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ring package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20230206.0~ds2-1.3').
